title: Indicator estimation
text: vignette, learn: format data indicator estimation. discover indicator functions available, data requirements additional parameters. perform estimation multiple indicators .

title: Indicator estimation
text: Data inputs estimation indicators data frames. indicators require inputs, data frames can four different kinds, depending : Whether describe stand-level vs. plant-level data Whether contain static vs. dynamic data following subsections provide examples four different data frames. single indicator may need data one kind (e.g. plant-level dynamic data), calculating several indicators , one may end-supplying one data frame.

title: Indicator estimation
text: data frame contains stand-level information change time, topographic features, area represented, etc. actual columns depend indicator calculated, least column id_stand (character) defined identify stands. example stand-level static data frame following:

title: Indicator estimation
text: data frame contains stand-level information change time, temperature, precipitation, stand leaf area index, canopy cover, etc. actual columns depend indicator calculated, least columns id_stand (character) date (Date) defined identify stands time points, respectively. example stand-level dynamic data frame following:

title: Indicator estimation
text: figure sizes customised can easily put two images side--side.
code: indicators <- c("timber_harvest", "density_dead_wood") additional_parameters[additional_parameters$indicator %in% indicators, ] #>           indicator        parameter default_value #> 1    timber_harvest         province          <NA> #> 2    timber_harvest     min_tree_dbh          <NA> #> 3    timber_harvest     max_tree_dbh          <NA> #> 4    timber_harvest targeted_species          <NA> #> 5    timber_harvest excluded_species          <NA> #> 8 density_dead_wood     min_tree_dbh          17.5 #> 9 density_dead_wood     max_tree_dbh          <NA> #>                                                                            description #> 1                                                      Spanish province (numeric code) #> 2            Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of harvest volume #> 3 Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of harvest volume #> 4                         Tree species included in the calculation of harvested volume #> 5                     Tree species not included in the calculation of harvested volume #> 8      Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood #> 9      Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood

title: Indicator estimation

title: Estimation of indicators of forest stands
text: Package forestindicators meant assist estimation indicators (metrics) forest stands, either derived forest inventory data forest model simulations. often, indicators estimate provision forest ecosystem services, package can understood generally platform estimate forest metrics.

title: Estimation of indicators of forest stands
text: Package forestindicators can installed GitHub. present, requires previous installation package IFNallometry also available GitHub : installed, can proceed installation forestindicators:

title: Estimation of indicators of forest stands
text: Two vignettes included illustrate: (1) use R package estimate indicators; (2) define new indicators.

title: Estimation of indicators of forest stands
text: Package forestindicators developed maintained Ecosystem Modelling Facility unit CREAF (Spain) Landscape Modelling Group CTFC (Spain).

title: Estimation of indicators of forest stands
text: Research project: Improving modelling key forest dynamic processes forecast long-term changes Mediterranean forests climate change (IMPROMED). Financial Entity: Ministerio de Ciencia e Innovación (PID2023-152644NB-I00). Duration : 01/09/2024 : 31/08/2025. PI: Miquel De Cáceres/Josep Mª Espelta.

title: Additional parameters for indicators — additional_parameters
text: data frame description additional parameters indicator functions

title: Additional parameters for indicators — additional_parameters
text: data frame indicator additional parameters rows columns: indicator_name: String indicator name. contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). parameter: String parameter name, defined indicator function. default_value: Default value parameter. description: String describing function parameter.

title: Available indicator information — available_indicators
text: Provides list indicators currently available

title: Available indicator information — available_indicators
text: data frame information available indicator functions requirements.

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
text: Estimates forest indicators given set forest stands given set dates evaluation.

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
code: estimate_indicators(   indicators,   stand_static_input = NULL,   stand_dynamic_input = NULL,   plant_static_input = NULL,   plant_dynamic_input = NULL,   timber_volume_function = NULL,   plant_biomass_function = NULL,   additional_params = list(),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
text: indicators character vector containing indicators estimated. stand_static_input data frame (sf object) containing static stand variables. Minimum required column id_stand (character). stand_dynamic_input Optional data frame containing dynamic stand variables. Minimum required columns id_stand (character) date (Date). plant_static_input Optional data frame containing static plant variables. Minimum required columns id_stand (character) plant_entity (character). plant_dynamic_input Optional data frame containing dynamic plant variables. Minimum required columns id_stand (character), plant_entity (character) date (Date). timber_volume_function Optional function supplied timber volume calculation. plant_biomass_function Optional function supplied whole-plant biomass calculation. additional_params Optional named list element turn list additional parameters required internal indicator functions. additional parameters indicator found table additional_parameters. verbose logical flag provide information progress

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
text: data frame following columns: id_stand - Stand identifier. date - Date indicator assessment. ... - Additional columns names equal strings given indicators.

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
text: Additional details...

title: Estimate forest indicators — estimate_indicators
code: ## Vector of indicator names to be estimated indicators <- c("timber_harvest", "density_dead_wood")  ## Determine which additional parameters are needed additional_parameters[additional_parameters$indicator %in% indicators, ] #>           indicator        parameter default_value #> 1    timber_harvest         province          <NA> #> 2    timber_harvest     min_tree_dbh          <NA> #> 3    timber_harvest     max_tree_dbh          <NA> #> 4    timber_harvest targeted_species          <NA> #> 5    timber_harvest excluded_species          <NA> #> 8 density_dead_wood     min_tree_dbh          17.5 #> 9 density_dead_wood     max_tree_dbh          <NA> #>                                                                            description #> 1                                                      Spanish province (numeric code) #> 2            Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of harvest volume #> 3 Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of harvest volume #> 4                         Tree species included in the calculation of harvested volume #> 5                     Tree species not included in the calculation of harvested volume #> 8      Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood #> 9      Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood  ## Named lists with additional parameters needed for each indicator add_params <- list(timber_harvest = list(province = 8),                    density_dead_wood = list(max_tree_dbh = 20))  ## Call indicator estimation res <- estimate_indicators(indicators,                            plant_dynamic_input = example_plant_dynamic_input,                            timber_volume_function = forestindicators:::.ifn_volume_forestindicators,                            additional_params = add_params,                            verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking overall inputs #> ✔ Checking overall inputs [6ms] #>  #> ℹ Checking inputs for 'timber_harvest'. #> ✔ Checking inputs for 'timber_harvest'. [11ms] #>  #> ℹ Processing 'timber_harvest'. #> ✔ Processing 'timber_harvest'. [64ms] #>  #> ℹ Checking inputs for 'density_dead_wood'. #> ✔ Checking inputs for 'density_dead_wood'. [11ms] #>  #> ℹ Processing 'density_dead_wood'. #> ✔ Processing 'density_dead_wood'. [19ms] #>

title: Indicator definition and requirements — indicator_definition
text: data frame implemented indicator metrics requirements

title: Indicator definition and requirements — indicator_definition
text: data frame indicators rows columns: indicator_name: String indicator name. contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). stand_static_variables: String stand static variables (e.g. slope) separated commas. Variable names contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). stand_dynamic_variables: String stand dynamic variables (e.g. canopy cover, stand leaf area index) separated commas. Variable names contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). plant_static_variables: String plant static variables separated commas. Variable names contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). plant_dynamic_variables: String plant dynamic variables (e.g. dbh, height, cover) separated commas. Variable names contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). output_units: String describing units indicator metric (e.g. Mg/ha). estimation_method: String describing procedure indicator estimation. interpretation: String describing indicator interpreted common usage. implementation_responsible: Name person responsible definition implementation indicator within package.

title: Input variable definitions — variable_definition
text: data frame variable definitions units, used indicator estimation

title: Input variable definitions — variable_definition
text: data frame variables rows columns: variable_name: String variable name. contain spaces (use underscore multiple word separation). level: String describing level (scale) variable applies, either 'stand' 'plant'. type: String variable type, either 'character' 'numeric'. units: String indicating variable units. description: String verbal description variable.
